definition: A request for data from a data source, using a specific syntax.
A request to modify data on a data source, using a specific syntax.
A temporary storage location for frequently accessed data, used to improve performance.
A function that allows you to manually refetch data from a data source.
A function that allows you to manually invalidate cached data, forcing a refetch on the next query.
A technique for updating the UI optimistically, before the server has confirmed the update.
A technique for updating the UI pessimistically, after the server has confirmed the update.
A unique identifier for a query, used to cache and refetch data.
A unique identifier for a mutation, used to cache and refetch data.
A client-side object that manages queries and mutations, and provides access to the cache.
A function that returns a query result, using a specific syntax.
A function that returns a mutation result, using a specific syntax.
A React hook that returns a query result, using a specific syntax.
A React hook that returns a mutation result, using a specific syntax.
A React hook that returns a query result, using a specific syntax.
A React hook that returns a mutation result, using a specific syntax.
A React hook that returns the query client object.
A React hook that returns a boolean indicating whether any queries are currently fetching data.
A React hook that returns a boolean indicating whether any mutations are currently in progress.
A React component that resets the error state of queries within its boundary.
